title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, both very relaxed. The interviewers very all very kind and asked the kind of questions one would expect in this interview. The process was less than a week and a half.
Interview Questions: How do you manage a busy schedule?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a 2 part interview. First it was a phone screening and then a teams call with the administrator. The interview process was very straightforward as they asked about your training background and experience with working with children. The administrators were willing to listen as well as ask follow up questions as needed
Interview Questions: What is your clinical background? Are you comfortable with working with children? How do you deal with difficult clients?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone interview with a good follow-up from the agency. However, I found their payment model highly suspect, as well as their extremely short session lengths. I also got passive aggressive pushback for some things I asked about, which was off-putting.
Interview Questions: What kind of clinical experience do you have?

title: Psychotherapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty streamlined.  I had an initial interview followed by a more in-depth one with two other supervisors. About a week later I received a call with an offer.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to work for NYPCC?

title: Behavior Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions:
it's a panel interview but not too many people showed up. 
quite straightforward. 
HR asked questions and the director afterwards. most questions are behavioral, not clinical. about 30 minutes. 
warm and kind. can not see anything indicator of success or not.
Interview Questions: what's your time management skill.

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and conversational. Felt like the interviewers were personable and enjoyed their time. They were able to answer any questions that I had and I had heard back from them later in the week
Interview Questions: Questions based on my resume and past experience. Some case study/scenario questions.

title: Full Time Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (Bronx, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was Quick, thorough and quick response, helpful, provided quick deadline to answer if position will be accepted or not for the full time therapist position, giving only a two day response time.
Interview Questions: Psychotherapy approaches, managing time, structuring work day

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were very friendly and asked great questions. They genuinely seemed interested in getting to know me. I learned more about the position and different ways to build income. It was a very informative interview.
Interview Questions: What brought you into the field of counseling?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Great and easy process! People are respectful and interview was engaging! The questions were easy to answer and the process was remotely as well! Nonetheless, people were great interviewers, they followed up quickly and I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress? Why NYPCC? What can you bring to the team?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions: very friendly and professional staff, no pressure and provided a lot of information,  the staff allowed to ask as many questions as I wished and did her best to answer them fully.
Interview Questions: various questions all related to the topic of the interview

title: Bilingual Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions: Had to a prescreening interview and then an interview. Then was notified within a week of the interview. It was very easy and not too hard. They were all very welcoming and nice.
Interview Questions:
How would I handle a client who is suicidal?
How would I approach a client who does not come to sessions every week.

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward. They were very sweet and straightforward. It was more of a conversation rather than Q and A. I really enjoyed the process. Just make sure to be familiar with your modalities as a therapist and stick to your counseling style. They want to get to know you as a therapist and what you feel you can contribute to the company. I just shared my passion for helping others, specifically, those who are underserved. Make sure to prepare and you should be fine.
Interview Questions: Q. What would a typical day look like ?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions: There is an initial 15 minute phone call. If it went well, they will advance you to the next step which will be a formal interview. This interview is about 45 minutes and has three people on it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your clinical experience

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (Bronx, NY) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: A 10 minute phone interview was scheduled. Then a week later, I did a 20 -30 minute video interview with 3 people. Everyone was really nice. Received a job offer within 24 hrs of the video interview.
Interview Questions: How many clients have you had at once?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (New York, NY) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: PowerPoint presentation. 2 interviews plus a phone screening. Need to be finger printed and trainings need to be completed beforehand. It’s a very extensive process but if you make it past it, you’re in for good. The questions they ask are very intense so prepare yourself. They ask scenario based questions.
Interview Questions: A situation in which you went above and beyond for a client. How to deal with a difficult client. Strengths weaknesses. What would you do if you disagreed with a superior.

title: Psychotherapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a screening call with a recruiter, brief and informative. They got back to me very quickly after I submitted my application online, consistent with others and their posts.
Interview Questions: Benefits package, checking in with experience

title: Full Time Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: NYPCC is really fast with getting back to candidates/applicants. I applied on a Friday and heard back from a HR rep by Monday. The first step is a phone screening with the HR rep. She asked me basic questions like if I was fluent in Spanish, my degree and credentials, what my ideal case load would look like, etc. She briefly went over the benefits package and the structure of NYPCC. After the screening and overview, she invited me for a virtual interview with the program manager, herself, and another HR rep.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for NYPCC and tell me about your professional experience?

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (New York, NY) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: HR and program administrator were very friendly. HR explained pay and benefits well. Program admin asked a few questions nothing too difficult. I asked the next steps and  then would get back to me in a week
Interview Questions: How would I engage a client who did not want to be there

title: Bilingual Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview was basic, basic questions, basic answers. Interview was very nice and I enjoyed it very much. Thank you so much Glassdoor, really, I cannot thank you enough. I plan to name my first-born glass door.
Interview Questions: Experience with Spanish speaking population

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: I registered for the Bronx virtual Open House, and submitted my resume online. I had a 3-5 minute screening and then was forwarded to the Program Administrator for a 10-15 minute interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your clinical experience

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Attended an open house at The Bronx location. When you arrive, you sign in and are seated in the lobby amongst the clients (adults and children) as you wait to be called for an interview. I believe this is to acclimate you to the population you would be working with. 

After over an hour of waiting, the first point of contact is with Tiffany the talent acquisition manager. Similar to another reviewer I met with Tiffany, we spoke briefly for what felt like 5 seconds.  I immediately got the sense that this wasn't a match from her responses. It's a "hired on the spot" event so if you're not hired on the spot obviously you're not moving forward.  I would have appreciated it if she was upfront and told me I was unqualified/not moving forward instead of saying that the hiring team would be in touch. It's a slap in the face after watching others come back to the lobby to fill out paperwork. 

I would advise that they be clear on the open house flyers the kind of and/or length of experience they are hoping for to prevent time being wasted on both ends. I too, was turned off by the experience. Sucks because the company is truly a gem for their employees.
Interview Questions: Clinical experience

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center
Interview Descriptions: I attended an open house interview day at NYPCC. The facility was packed with children in a huge waiting room. I had to sign in and wait for my name to be called. I watched as those who were before me were called and noticed that some were coming out with paperwork and others with nothing. It became clear that those who were given paperwork to fill out were the ones they were interested in, and these people also went back into the interview room to meet with someone else. I waited an hour and a half until I was called. The woman who interviewed me didn’t introduce herself at all but apologized for the long wait. I gave her my resume and she barely looked at it. She asked me very general questions and I sat with her for 7-8 minutes max. At the end she said that I would hear from them the following day as to whether or not they wanted to move forward with the interviewing process. It was clear that I wouldn’t be offered a position (which was confirmed in an email I received about a week later) because I wasn’t given any paperwork. I would have appreciated her being honest and saying to my face that they were moving forward with other candidates. This whole thing really turned me off, and in combination with her description of the job, I knew this wasn’t a place I wanted to work if I had been offered.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with our clients?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Waited for a little bit but it was an open house. I got called the next day to interview and then I got hired the following day.  I got a phone call and an email with the job offer.
Interview Questions: Q. What makes you stand out?

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (Bronx, NY) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: First there is a phone interview so be prepared to answer several questions if and when they call. The second interview is when you meet with Managers and at the Bronx location means meeting with about 3 people getting to know you, they talk about engagement skills, and how well you will be able to handle crisis or difficult situations. Overall very straight forward interview process.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a session with a teenager who was on his phone and very uninterested in therapy?

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (New York, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a 2 part process. The first part was a phone screening, gathering basic background information, this was probably a 15 minute process. The second part was a meeting with upper management and a HR representative. I felt comfortable with the 2 individuals I interviewed with, this process was the standard interview questions followed by a presentation by HR explaining their fee for service model and benefits. This second part was lengthy, probably an hour. Have to submit a writing piece afterwards.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to be a therapist? Weaknesses? Professional background.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: intense. They also offered a completely different salary online, but when i went in for the interview they low balled me, which is one reason i declined the position. I was very unhappy with the fact that they lied about how much they were going to pay.
Interview Questions: standard

title: Bilingual Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
It did not take too long too receive a call for an interview, probably 2-3 days. I was greeted by Ashley, she is super sweet and helpful. She provided all instructions necessary and scheduled my interview.  I was sent to the Brooklyn site due to it being closer to my residence.
The interview in itself was very straightforward but detailed. The administrator conducted the interview alongside the assistant administrator.  The administrator there, Nichole, wants to gain insight about your previous experiences. we discussed vulnerable populations and being culturally competent as well as aware of the needs of the people they serve. She  was friendly and made me feel comfortable throughout the process.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in becoming a social worker? (I have an MSW)

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (Brooklyn, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with Head of the Clinic, the assistant and Human Resource agent I had been in contact with  Felt less like an interview and more like a sales pitch as to why I should leave my current job and work for them. There alot of benefits which I would have been more inclined to accept if I had not been working with another clinic for a significant period of time.
Interview Questions: How do you stay on top of you paper work?

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center (Brooklyn, NY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a Senior Therapist. The process was laid back and friendly. She inquired about previous position and my ability to operate with different populations. We discussed past cases and how I was able to de-escalate the situation. She also informed me of the office environment and location to ensure I would be able to acclimate. I felt comfortable the entire time.
Interview Questions: Are you Bi-lingual? Can you have a conversation with a spanish speaker?
